title: EEOC EO 14168 guidance documents

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: EEOC EO 14168 guidance documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All guidance documents, memos, or other interpretation of policy — as well as sub-sections or parts of these documents — rescinded under Executive Order 14168, titled "Defending Women From Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government" or the Attorney General’s guidance issued pursuant to this order. Additionally, any records or lists of such rescinded guidance or parts of guidance.

Such documents include, but are not limited to, the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission’s “Enforcement Guidance on Harassment in the Workplace” (April 29, 2024).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Trans Journalists Association

title: Texas Public Information Act Request – August 1, 2023 Incident Involving Officer Caleb McWilliams

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Public Information Act Request – August 1, 2023 Incident Involving Officer Caleb McWilliams
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to and copies of all records related to the incident involving Amarillo Police Department Officer Caleb McWilliams on August 1, 2023, in Amarillo, Texas. According to reports, during this incident, Officer McWilliams was overpowered by a suspect who seized the officer’s firearm and discharged one round, grazing Officer McWilliams. A passing bystander, an unidentified 34-year-old man, intervened and assisted in subduing the suspect until backup officers arrived. Police body camera footage reportedly shows the bystander tackling the assailant from behind at a critical moment. The incident is documented under Amarillo PD Report #2023-000821, noting that the civilian's assistance likely saved the officer’s life.

I am seeking the following records related to this incident:

Incident and Arrest Reports: Complete reports detailing the events leading to and during the incident, including officer narratives, witness statements, and any supplementary documentation.

Body-Worn Camera Footage: All available footage from officers involved in the incident, capturing interactions with the suspect and the bystander from initial contact through the resolution of the situation.

Dashboard Camera Footage: Any available footage from patrol vehicles present during the incident, particularly those capturing the scene upon arrival and the subsequent events.

911 Call Records and Dispatch Logs: Audio recordings and transcripts of any emergency calls or dispatch communications related to this incident, including radio communications and Computer-Aided Dispatch (CAD) logs.

Photographs: Any images taken by the Amarillo Police Department during or after the incident, including photographs of Officer McWilliams, the suspect, the bystander, and the scene.

Use-of-Force Reports: Documentation of any use-of-force reports filed in relation to this incident.

Commendations or Recognitions: Any records of commendations or official recognitions awarded to the bystander for his actions during this incident.

The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making these records publicly accessible. While I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from disseminating these materials, the request primarily aims to enhance transparency regarding this law enforcement incident.

I request a waiver of fees associated with fulfilling this request, as disclosure of the requested information will contribute to public understanding of law enforcement practices and community interactions. However, if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance. Additionally, if fees can be reduced or eliminated by excluding certain records, please specify which records those would be.

Please provide the records in an electronic format if available. If any portions of this request are denied, please cite the specific legal exemption(s) and provide a redacted version of the document where applicable.

I appreciate your time and assistance in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Florida Public Records Request – December 16, 2023 DUI Arrest of Deputy Kristen Simpson

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida Public Records Request – December 16, 2023 DUI Arrest of Deputy Kristen Simpson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to and copies of all records related to the arrest of Seminole County Sheriff's Deputy Kristen Simpson on December 16, 2023, in DeLand, Florida. Deputy Simpson, 29, was off-duty when found asleep behind the wheel of her personal vehicle at the intersection of East Taylor Road and South Woodland Boulevard around 1 a.m. Upon awakening, her vehicle rolled forward and collided with a parked Volusia Sheriff's Office cruiser. She was subsequently arrested for driving under the influence and cited for careless driving.

I am seeking the following records related to this incident:

Incident and Arrest Reports: Complete reports detailing the events leading to the discovery of Deputy Simpson's vehicle, observations made by the responding officers, results of any sobriety tests, and the arrest, including any supplementary narratives.

Body-Worn Camera Footage: All available footage from officers involved in the response and arrest, capturing the interaction with Deputy Simpson from the initial contact through the arrest.

Dashboard Camera Footage: Any available footage from patrol vehicles present during the incident, particularly those capturing the scene upon arrival and the subsequent arrest.

911 Call Records and Dispatch Logs: Audio recordings and transcripts of any emergency calls or dispatch communications related to this incident, including radio communications and Computer-Aided Dispatch (CAD) logs.

Photographs: Any images taken by the DeLand Police Department during or after the arrest, including photographs of Deputy Simpson, her vehicle, the collision with the Volusia Sheriff's Office cruiser, and the scene.

Breathalyzer or Blood Test Results: Documentation of any breathalyzer or blood alcohol content (BAC) tests administered to Deputy Simpson, including the results.

Internal Affairs Reports: Any internal reviews, use-of-force reports, or investigations conducted by the DeLand Police Department or the Seminole County Sheriff's Office regarding this incident.

Press Releases or Official Statements: Any public communications released by the DeLand Police Department or the Seminole County Sheriff's Office concerning this incident.

The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making these records publicly accessible. While I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from disseminating these materials, the request primarily aims to enhance transparency regarding this law enforcement incident.

I request a waiver of fees associated with fulfilling this request, as disclosure of the requested information will contribute to public understanding of law enforcement practices and accountability. However, if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance. Additionally, if fees can be reduced or eliminated by excluding certain records, please specify which records those would be.

Please provide the records in an electronic format if available. If any portions of this request are denied, please cite the specific legal exemption(s) and provide a redacted version of the document where applicable.

I appreciate your time and assistance in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

title: Georgia Open Records Act Request – September 30, 2023 Incident at Kroger Grocery Store Involving Juveniles

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Georgia Open Records Act Request – September 30, 2023 Incident at Kroger Grocery Store Involving Juveniles
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to and copies of all records pertaining to the incident on September 30, 2023, at the Kroger grocery store located at Anderson Towne Center in Savannah, Georgia. On this date, a group of teenagers reportedly engaged in disruptive activities inspired by a TikTok "milk crate" challenge, which escalated into a public disturbance. Actions included throwing milk jugs, entering a live lobster tank, and defying store security. Upon police arrival, the teenagers allegedly used profane language and refused orders to disperse, necessitating backup units. Seven juveniles, aged 14–17, were arrested on charges including rioting, criminal mischief, and battery on officers, following physical altercations where some teens reportedly kicked at police officers.

I am seeking the following records related to this incident:

Incident Reports: Complete reports detailing the events, actions taken by officers, and charges filed against the individuals involved.
Arrest Records: Documentation pertaining to the arrests of the seven juveniles, including arrest affidavits and booking information.
Body-Worn Camera Footage: All available footage from officers responding to the incident, capturing interactions with the individuals involved and the actions taken during the event.
Dash Camera Footage: Any available footage from patrol vehicles at the scene, particularly those capturing the exterior of the Kroger store and the arrival/departure of law enforcement units.
Surveillance Footage: Copies of the store's surveillance videos that recorded the incident, if obtained by law enforcement as part of the investigation.
911 Call Records: Audio recordings and transcripts of all emergency calls related to the incident, including initial reports from store employees or patrons.
Dispatch Logs: Records of communications between dispatch and responding officers, including timestamps and descriptions of the situation as it unfolded.
Use of Force Reports: Any documentation filed due to the physical altercations between the juveniles and officers, including reports of officers being kicked or otherwise assaulted.
Photographs: Any images taken by law enforcement at the scene, including evidence of property damage, injuries, or other relevant aspects of the incident.
Press Releases or Public Statements: Any official communications released by the Chatham County Sheriff's Office or Savannah Police Department regarding this incident.
The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making these records publicly accessible. While I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from disseminating these materials, the request primarily aims to enhance transparency regarding this law enforcement incident.

I request a waiver of fees associated with fulfilling this request, as disclosure of the requested information will contribute to public understanding of law enforcement's response to public disturbances involving juveniles. However, if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance. Additionally, if fees can be reduced or eliminated by excluding certain records, please specify which records those would be.

Please provide the records in an electronic format if available. If any portions of this request are denied, please cite the specific legal exemption(s) and provide a redacted version of the document where applicable.

I appreciate your time and assistance in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Tennessee Open Records Act Request – September 20, 2022 Arrest of Tarius Sledge at East Ridge High School

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee Open Records Act Request – September 20, 2022 Arrest of Tarius Sledge at East Ridge High School
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to and copies of all records pertaining to the arrest of Tarius Sledge on September 20, 2022, at East Ridge High School in East Ridge, Tennessee. Mr. Sledge, an 18-year-old student, was involved in an altercation with School Resource Deputy (SRD) Tyler McRae during a gym class session. The incident escalated when Mr. Sledge allegedly refused to comply with instructions, leading to a physical confrontation that included SRD McRae pulling Mr. Sledge by his hair and deploying pepper spray. This event was partially captured on video, which subsequently circulated widely on social media platforms.

I am seeking the following records related to this incident:

All available body-worn camera footage from SRD Tyler McRae and any other officers present during the incident, including the entirety of the interaction with Mr. Sledge.
All available surveillance footage from East Ridge High School's gymnasium and surrounding areas capturing the incident.
The complete incident and arrest reports, including all officer narratives, supplemental reports, and witness statements from school staff, students, and other individuals present.
All 911 call recordings and dispatch logs related to this incident, including radio communications and Computer-Aided Dispatch (CAD) reports.
Any photographs taken by the Hamilton County Sheriff's Office during or after the incident, including images of Mr. Sledge, the involved officers, and the location of the altercation.
The full arrest affidavits and any related charging documents filed in this case.
Any internal reviews, use-of-force reports, or investigations conducted by the Hamilton County Sheriff's Office regarding this incident.
Any press releases, social media posts, or official statements made by the Hamilton County Sheriff's Office or East Ridge High School regarding this incident.
The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making these records publicly accessible. While I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from disseminating these materials, the request primarily aims to enhance transparency regarding this law enforcement incident.

title: Public Records Request – September 27, 2023 Arrest of Cathy S. Luks

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of all records related to the arrest of Cathy S. Luks on September 27, 2023, in Parma, Ohio. Ms. Luks, 66, a former mayor of North Royalton, was involved in a high-speed chase following a minor speeding violation. The pursuit concluded when she collided with a tow truck after jumping a curb. During the arrest, body-worn camera footage reportedly captured Ms. Luks asserting, "I’m the former mayor!" before officers used pepper spray due to her non-compliance. She was subsequently charged with Operating a Vehicle under the Influence (OVI), failure to comply, and possession of an open container.

I am requesting the following records related to this incident:

All available body-worn camera footage from all officers involved in the traffic stop, pursuit, and arrest of Cathy S. Luks
All available dashboard camera (dashcam) footage from all patrol vehicles involved in the incident
The complete incident and arrest reports, including all officer narratives, supplemental reports, and witness statements
All 911 call recordings and dispatch logs related to this incident, including radio communications and Computer-Aided Dispatch (CAD) reports
Any photographs taken by the Parma Police Department during or after the arrest, including images of the suspect, her vehicle, the crash scene, and any evidence recovered
The full arrest affidavits and any related charging documents filed in this case
Any internal reviews or reports related to the use of force during the arrest, including documentation of the deployment of pepper spray
Any press releases, social media posts, or official statements made by the Parma Police Department regarding this incident
The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making these records publicly accessible. While I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from the dissemination of these materials, the request primarily serves to enhance transparency regarding this law enforcement incident.

I request a waiver of fees associated with fulfilling this request, as disclosure of the requested information will contribute to public understanding of law enforcement practices and actions. However, if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance. Additionally, if fees can be reduced or eliminated by excluding certain records, please specify which records those would be.

Please provide the records in an electronic format if available. If any portions of this request are denied, please cite the specific legal exemption(s) and provide a redacted version of the document where applicable.

I appreciate your time and assistance in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Public Records Request – February 21, 2022 DUI Arrest of Stephanie Bloodworth

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of all records related to the February 21, 2022, DUI arrest of Stephanie Bloodworth on Duck Key, Monroe County, Florida. Bloodworth, 24, crashed her Tesla on her father’s private island while allegedly driving under the influence. Responding Monroe County deputies encountered her inside the wrecked vehicle, where she initially refused to exit, claiming, “My father owns this island!” Upon being removed, she resisted arrest, kicked and screamed, and was recorded on bodycam crying, “I need my dad here!” Deputies later used an airboat to recover evidence, including open vodka bottles. She was arrested and charged with DUI, resisting arrest, and fleeing law enforcement.

I am requesting the following records related to this incident:

All available body-worn camera footage from all deputies involved in the response, arrest, and transportation of Stephanie Bloodworth, specifically between 9:00 PM and 9:30 PM
All available dashboard camera dashcam footage from all responding patrol vehicles present at the scene
All 911 call recordings and dispatch logs related to this incident, including radio communications and CAD reports
The complete incident and arrest reports, including all officer narratives, supplemental reports, and use-of-force documentation
The full DUI report, blood alcohol test results, and any toxicology findings associated with this case
All booking documents, jail intake records, and any recorded statements made by Stephanie Bloodworth following her arrest
All photographs taken by the Monroe County Sheriff's Office MCSO during or after the arrest, including images of the suspect, the crashed Tesla, the crash site, and recovered evidence such as open vodka bottles
Any video footage from airboat operations or any surveillance footage that may have captured the crash, response, or evidence recovery
Any internal reviews or reports related to this incident, including documents regarding the use of an airboat for evidence retrieval
Any press releases, social media posts, or official statements made by the Monroe County Sheriff’s Office regarding this incident

The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making these records publicly accessible. While I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from the dissemination of these materials, the request primarily serves to enhance transparency regarding this law enforcement incident.

I request a waiver of fees associated with fulfilling this request, as disclosure of the requested information will contribute to public understanding of law enforcement practices and actions. However, if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance. title: Public Records Request – October 12, 2022 Eviction Incident Involving Rorie Susan Woods

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request – October 12, 2022 Eviction Incident Involving Rorie Susan Woods
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of all records related to the October 12, 2022, incident at 49 Memery Lane, Longmeadow, Hampden County, Massachusetts, involving Rorie Susan Woods and Hampden County Sheriff's Deputies. During an eviction enforcement action, Woods arrived at the scene towing multiple active beehives and, while dressed in a beekeeper suit, deliberately shook and smashed the hives, releasing swarms of aggressive bees onto law enforcement officers. Several deputies sustained bee stings, and at least one required hospitalization due to an allergic reaction. Woods was arrested on-site and charged with assault and battery by means of a dangerous weapon (the bees).

I am requesting the following records related to this incident:

All available body-worn camera footage from any deputies present at the scene, if applicable
All available dashboard camera dashcam footage from any responding or on-site sheriff’s vehicles
Any cellphone, surveillance, or third-party footage collected or utilized by the Hampden County Sheriff’s Department related to this incident
The complete incident report filed by the Hampden County Sheriff’s Civil Process Division, including all deputy narratives and supplemental reports
All photographs taken by deputies or crime scene investigators, including images of the beehives, the suspect, the deputies involved, and any injuries sustained
All medical or injury reports filed by deputies who sustained bee stings during the attack
Any official internal memos, use-of-force reports, or debriefing summaries regarding this incident
Any forensic or evidence collection reports related to the beehives, bees, or equipment used in the attack
All 911 call recordings or dispatch logs related to this incident, including communications before, during, and after the attack
Any press releases, social media posts, or official statements made by the Hampden County Sheriff’s Department or Sheriff Nicholas Cocchi regarding this incident

The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making these records publicly accessible. While I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from the dissemination of these materials, the request primarily serves to enhance transparency regarding this law enforcement incident.

I request a waiver of fees associated with fulfilling this request, as disclosure of the requested information will contribute to public understanding of law enforcement practices and actions. However, if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance. Additionally, if fees can be reduced or eliminated by excluding certain records, please specify which records those would be.

Please provide the records in an electronic format if available. If any portions of this request are denied, please cite the specific legal exemption(s) and provide a redacted version of the document where applicable.

I appreciate your time and assistance in this matter.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

Fax: (202) 732-4265

CRITICAL NOTICE – READ CAREFULLY – COMPREHENSIVE COMPLIANCE REQUIRED

This FOIA request contains legally binding instructions that must be followed in their entirety. Failure to comply with any portion—including the detailed search methodology, records preservation directives, or production requirements—will be construed as noncompliance under 5 U.S.C. § 552 and may result in immediate legal action.

SUBJECT:
REQUEST FOR ALL Records pertaining to contracts and arrangements involving airplane companies and private security firms for deportation operations
(Focus: Records from January 1, 2018 to Present, with particular emphasis on documents generated during Trump’s first and current presidencies.)

I. INTRODUCTION & SCOPE

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and applicable agency regulations, I hereby request access to and copies of all records, contracts, memoranda, agreements, proposals, directives, and communications regarding ICE’s engagements with:

AIRPLANE COMPANIES

All records (contracts, amendments, proposals, and related communications) between ICE (and its subordinate components) and airplane companies utilized to charter deportation flights.
Context: Investigative reports, such as the University of Washington article “ICE, Air, and Deportation: The King County Case” (https://jsis.washington.edu/humanrights/2019/04/23/ice-air-king-county/), detail ICE’s use of charter flights in deportation efforts.
Legal Precedents:
• Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989)
• Milner v. Department of Navy, 562 U.S. 562 (2011)
PRIVATE SECURITY FIRMS

All records involving contracts, agreements, and related communications between ICE (and its sub-offices) and private security companies that provide operational support (e.g., ground escorts, logistical services) during deportation operations.
Legal Precedents:
• Electronic Privacy Information Center v. Department of Justice, 416 F. Supp. 2d 30 (D.D.C. 2006)
• Judicial Watch, Inc. v. U.S. Department of Defense, 857 F. Supp. 2d 44 (D.D.C. 2012)
Additional Reporting: See “ICE contractor flight to Seattle may signal Washington state detention center will fill up” (The Spokesman-Review, Feb. 5, 2025).
Time Frame & Focus on Trump’s Presidencies:
This request covers all responsive records from January 1, 2018 through the present. For the purposes of this request:

"Trump’s first presidency" refers to his time in office from January 20, 2017 through January 20, 2021. Since the requested records begin on January 1, 2018, this period will cover records generated during the majority of his first term.
"Trump’s current presidency" refers to his second term, which began on January 20, 2025, and continues to the present.
II. DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS REQUESTED

To ensure full compliance and eliminate ambiguity, please produce all responsive documents, including but not limited to:

A. Contracts & Agreements

All executed contracts, amendments, proposals, and related communications between ICE (and its sub-offices) and:
Airplane companies used to operate deportation flights.
Private security firms providing additional operational support services.
B. Communications & Internal Directives

All internal communications (emails, instant messages, memos, briefing documents, meeting minutes, and draft versions) among ICE officials regarding:
The contracting process and oversight of deportation flight arrangements.
Evaluation, modifications, and performance assessments of such contracts.
C. Policy Documents & Operational Guidelines

All finalized or draft policy documents, guidelines, or standard operating procedures that authorize or regulate:
The engagement of external contractors (both airplane companies and private security firms) for deportation operations.
Oversight and performance evaluation of these contracted services.
D. Search Methodology Documentation

A detailed account of the search strategies used to identify responsive records, including:
• The systems and databases searched (e.g., ICE’s electronic records management systems, contract databases, email servers).
• Search terms, date ranges, custodians, and personnel involved.
• Complete search logs and documentation verifying that all relevant systems were thoroughly searched.
III. CUSTODIANS & SYSTEMS

Please search all relevant ICE components and sub-offices, including but not limited to:
• ICE Headquarters and Regional Offices
• ICE’s Office of Detention and Removal
• ICE’s Contracting, Procurement, and related administrative divisions

Systems to be searched include:
• Electronic records management and email systems
• Contract and document management platforms
• Digital repositories or archives where such contracts and communications are stored

IV. LEGAL AUTHORITIES & PRECEDENTS

This request is substantiated by established FOIA precedent and the public’s right to know, including:
• Department of Justice v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 489 U.S. 749 (1989)
• Milner v. Department of Navy, 562 U.S. 562 (2011)
• Electronic Privacy Information Center v. Department of Justice, 416 F. Supp. 2d 30 (D.D.C. 2006)
• Judicial Watch, Inc. v. U.S. Department of Defense, 857 F. Supp. 2d 44 (D.D.C. 2012)

V. EXPEDITED PROCESSING & FEE WAIVER

Due to the significant public interest in ensuring transparency regarding ICE’s contracting practices related to deportation operations—and in light of the policies enacted during both of Trump’s presidencies—I request expedited processing pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II). Furthermore, I request a complete waiver of fees under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii) on the basis that disclosure of these records will substantially contribute to public understanding of ICE operations and accountability in government contracting.

VI. FORMAT OF PRODUCTION

Please produce all responsive records in their native electronic formats with full metadata intact. This includes:
• Emails and documents in their native file formats (e.g., .MSG, .EML, .DOCX, .PDF, etc.).
• Structured data in searchable electronic formats (e.g., .CSV, .XML) along with any accompanying data dictionaries.
• Search documentation provided in a verifiable electronic format.

For any records that exist solely in paper form, please provide high-resolution scanned copies (minimum 300 dpi) in PDF format.

VII. PRESERVATION & ADMINISTRATIVE TRACKING

Until a final determination on this request is rendered, please ensure that all responsive records are preserved in their entirety, including all associated metadata. In addition, please provide:
• The tracking number assigned to this request.
• The names and titles of the FOIA officers handling this request.
• Detailed documentation of the search methodologies employed.

VIII. RIGHT TO APPEAL & STATUTORY DEADLINES

I expressly reserve the right to appeal any adverse determination, including denials of expedited processing, fee waiver, or inadequacies in the search. I expect a determination on this request within 20 working days (or 10 calendar days if expedited processing applies) as mandated by 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i).

IX. FINAL WARNING & DISCLAIMER

YOU ARE HEREBY NOTIFIED:
Any failure to comply with these detailed instructions—including conducting a comprehensive search across all relevant systems and custodians—will be deemed noncompliance with FOIA obligations and may serve as grounds for immediate judicial review and legal action pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(B) and related case law.

Please acknowledge receipt of this request and provide the assigned tracking number within five (5) working days. For any clarifications, contact me immediately rather than resorting to delay tactics.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter
Investigative Journalist

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Tampa Bay Rays contract with St. Petersburg
communications.communication:
Good morning:

Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of St. Petersburg, FL. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 3/18/2025. Section 119.07(4), Florida Statutes, provides for fees and charges for processing public records requests.  Extensive use of information technology resources and extensive clerical or supervisory assistance will require payment of a special service charge for the use of such information technology resources and labor cost of personnel to process the request.  A cost estimate will be provided to you should copy fees or special service charges be assessed.  These costs must be paid prior to record retrieval and production.  Please direct any questions to the Office of the City Clerk.


Records Requested:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- All records relating to the current contract between the Tampa Bay Rays and the City of St. Petersburg and their current lease at Tropicana Field that runs through 2028.
- All records, communications, and correspondence relating to the city’s plan to have Tropicana Field repaired before the start of the 2026 season, including the Rays’ support of the plan, between January 1, 2025, and the date this request is received.
- All records, communications, and correspondence relating to the development of a new stadium in St. Petersburg for the Rays, between January 1, 2025, and the date this request is received.

I am specifically looking for a list of responsive records including, but not limited to, relevant contracts and amendments, meeting notes related to these agreements, and emails and other written communications referring to these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.


Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s) to process your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Public Records Law does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions.


Best Regards,

Chan Srinivasa, Sr., MBA, CMC
City Clerk, Director
City of St. Petersburg
175 Fifth Street North
St. Petersburg, FL 33701
Office: (727) 893-7202
Chandrahasa.Srinivasa@stpete.org<mailto:Chandrahasa.Srinivasa@stpete.org>

[Under Florida Statute 119 (Public Records) your email communications may be subject to public disclosure.]

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tim Neeley

title: police brutality investigation

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: police brutality investigation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following:

Employment Status Confirmation: If Officer Edgar I. De Hoyos has never made an arrest, please provide a sworn statement confirming his current employment status and exact dates of service with the McAllen Police Department, from his hire date of September 26, 2022, to the present (March 17, 2025).
Arrest Reports: If Officer De Hoyos has made arrests, provide all arrest reports from September 26, 2022, to March 17, 2025, where he is listed as the arresting officer, including:
Report number
Date of arrest
Charges filed
Name of the individual arrested
Please note that records for cases no longer under active investigation are not exempt under TPIA and must be disclosed.
Disciplinary Records: All disciplinary records, internal affairs investigations, reprimands, and citizen complaints involving Officer Edgar I. De Hoyos, from September 26, 2022, to March 17, 2025, including:
Dates of incidents
Summaries of allegations
Resolutions or outcomes
If these records are held by the Civil Service Office per your prior referral, please coordinate with that office to fulfill this request or provide their direct contact for a separate submission.
This request pertains to existing records only, as required under TPIA. Given Officer De Hoyos’ documented role as a Police Officer III in the Tactical Patrol Unit (effective September 9, 2024), it is implausible that no arrest records exist after over two years of service. Be advised that this is part of a broader, ongoing investigation into potential misconduct specifically police brutality, and any failure to comply fully with TPIA may result in escalation to the Texas Attorney General’s Office for review.

If any portion of this request is deemed exempt, please cite the specific TPIA exemption and provide non-exempt portions as required by law. If a determination from the Texas Attorney General is sought, please provide a copy of that request and the subsequent ruling. I expect a response within 10 business days, per TPIA §552.221.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David

title: Cybercheck communications and contracts

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Cybercheck communications and contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents since Jan. 1, 2021 between Gainsville Police Department and Global Intelligence Inc. (also called Cybercheck or Cybercheck.AI) for the provision of the Cybercheck service.

2. All email exchanges, including attachments, between Gainsville Police Department staff and email addresses with the domain "@cybercheck.ai" between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

3. All emails, including attachments, between staff of Gainsville Police Department that reference Cybercheck or its provider Global Intelligence, sent between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

I kindly request that you waive all fees as I am a journalist and the requested records will be used for journalism in the public interest.

If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfil the request.

If you choose to reject this request or redact portions of responsive documents, I ask that you provide a detailed breakdown of the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jessica Hatcher

title: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman    List of Reserve Deputies

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman    List of Reserve Deputies
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

We would like the status of DJ Adams as a reserve deputy, also we would appreciate an entire list of every person who is a Reserve Deputy and the date they became a Reserve Deputy.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman    List of Reserve Deputies
communications.communication:
Good morning,
I have forwarded the below request to the Sheriff’s Office.
Thank you
